definitions: To make something square or rectangular in shape.
To multiply a number by itself.
To make things equal or in agreement.
To pay a debt or settle an account.
To adjust one's shoulders or body to a more upright or confrontational position.
examples: He squared the edges of the wood.
She squared the number seven to get forty-nine.
He squared his account with the bank.
The boxer squared his shoulders before the fight.
